data.text:
Paris, the city of love, has more than 200 museums. To make your choice, we offer you a list of the 10 most romantic museums in Paris.

Museum of Romantic Life

Inaugurated in 1987, the Museum of Romantic Life is located in the 9th arrondissement of Paris in the district called “The New Athens”. This museum was installed in the old residence filled with a romantic charm, of the painter of Dutch origin Ary Scheffer. You can discover many of his works there, such as “The Princess of Joinville” or “Sophie Marin”. Do not leave the premises without having taken advantage of the tea room installed under the glass roof and its small garden.

Hotel Scheffer-Renan – 16, rue Chaptal – 75009 Paris

http://www.museevieromantique.paris.fr/

Orsay Museum

Source: © Musée d’Orsay / Patrice Schmidt

The Musée d’Orsay is THE cultural outing to do for two, as a couple. First of all, the famous museum is located in a heavenly place in the city of light, along the quays of the Seine, facing the Tuileries Garden. Then, the Musée d’Orsay has an exceptional history. Did you know that it was originally a station built for the Universal Exhibition of 1900? Finally, the Musée d’Orsay houses a unique collection of paintings from the Impressionist period and sculptures signed by the greatest masters: Rodin, Degas, Maillol… The Musée d’Orsay is perfect for romantic cultivation.

Orsay Museum – 62, rue de Lille – 75343 Paris Cedex 07

http://www.musee-orsay.fr

The Louvre

Visiting the Louvre Museum as a couple means immersing yourself in one of the most emblematic monuments of Paris, in a place steeped in history (small and larges), and sharing a parenthesis out of time. As you walk through the Louvre hand in hand, you can’t help but imagine yourself as king and queen, following in the footsteps of its last and prestigious tenant, Louis XIV.

Louvre Museum – Rue de Rivoli, 75001 Paris –

www.louvre.fr

Cognacq Jay

The history of this museum is just incredible and above all very romantic. This museum is the legacy of a fabulous love story between Ernest Cognacq (founder of La Samaritaine) and Marie-Louise Jay who became his wife. Ernest Cognacq donated his collection of 18th century works of art to the town hall of Paris so that it could be exhibited to the general public.

Cognacq-Jay Museum – 8 rue Elzévir – 75003 Paris –

http://www.museecognacqjay.paris.fr

The Little Palace

Looking for a cultural visitduringa week- end in love? Direction the Petit Palais. This museum located between the Seine and the Champs Elysées is at the center of an exceptional architectural ensemble since in a few steps, you find yourself at Place de la Concorde, on the most beautiful avenue in the world, on the Alexandre III bridge, at the Invalides or at the Grand Palais. Take a gourmet break in the interior garden, away from the noise of the city and from prying eyes.

Petit Palais – Avenue Winston Churchill, 75008 Paris

http://www.petitpalais.paris.fr/

Rodin Museum

Built under the Ancien Régime, the Rodin Museum in Paris is a call to romanticism. You will be enchanted by the special charm of the Hôtel Biron, the sculpture garden, or even the chapel. You can also take a break, gaze into each other’s eyes, in the café of the Rodin Museum.

Rodin Museum – 77 rue de Varenne – 75007 Paris

Rodin Meudon Museum – 19 avenue Auguste Rodin 92190 Meudon

http://www.musee-rodin.fr

Louis Vuitton Foundation

Designed by architect Frank Gehry at the request of Bernard Arnault, the Louis Vuitton Foundation is an architectural masterpiece. With a 13,500 m² glass roof, this building is resolutely modern and innovative. He has also received numerous international architectural awards. This museum is for all lovers of modern art. Extend your visit with a romantic stroll in the Jardin d’Acclimatation which surrounds the museum.

Louis Vuitton Foundation – 8 avenue du Mahatma Gandhi – Bois de Boulogne – 75116 Paris

https://www.fondationlouisvuitton.fr

The Jacquemart André Museum

Edouard André was born in 1833 and became the heir to two of the largest fortunes in Europe. In 1872, he met Nelie Jacquemart, a young artist responsible for carrying out his portrait. 1881 was the year of their union. From then on, they traveled a lot to enlarge the collection of works of art. A part was resold and the vast majority is now exhibited in the Jacquemart André museum. The museum is the couple’s former mansion. This museum immerses you in the romantic atmosphere of the 19th century and brings the fabulous story of this couple to life.

Jacquemart André Museum 158 boulevard Haussmann 75008 Paris –

https://www.musee-jacquemart-andre.com

Château de Versailles

What could be more romantic than a visit, with your loved one, to the Palace of Versailles? To visit the official residence of the kings of France is to relive the splendor of this unique place in the world and to imagine yourself as monarch and sovereign, for the duration of a stroll. From March and October, the castle gardens are the scene of the great musical fountains, a breathtaking spectacle!

Palace of Versailles – Place d’armes – 78000 Versailles

http://www.chateauversailles.fr/

Grévin Museum

How about hanging out with Barack Obama, Pierre Hermé, Kad Merad or Ronaldo? It’s a unique experience for two, for a romantic weekend in Paris. This unique museum in France brings together the wax statues of several hundred celebrities (singers, actors, politicians, sportsmen, great chefs,).

Visiting the Grévin museum as a couple is the guarantee of an unforgettable and atypical.
